Amazing Game, Would always  recommend to anyone interested in survival horrors

BHVR needs to listen to the community. They need to fix the insane amount of bugs and not put out a chapter that introduces more. Please don't buy this game or any DLC for the next 3 months. If BHVR doesn't get money they'll hopefully be forced to actually do something. #DeadByBoycott

Just don't.

Edit: Hackers, crashing, bugs, and more really aren't making this game any better. Especially NFTs. You know they're going to get spicy and pull shit off with that.
amazing  game but limited if you dont spend money

Great game but you will encounter the odd problem here or there such as random disconnections with odd messages after a recent update (most games have this though) or occasionally a toxic player/killer's in the form of in game mechanic exploits or rude messages after game; However if you can see past all that as it's not all the time then can be a really fun game that you can sink many hours into, trying to get better as either the killer or survivor, a game that takes skills but also a dash of luck.

Enjoy! :P

Super fun game, there is a couple of warnings I would like to give however. Play survivor if you have friends to play with you, it is completely stupid to play without them because the randoms more than likely will leave you for dead. Killer is super fun and new players should definently  be playing killer to get better at survivor. That sounds like backwards logic but because when playing killer you get to see how what survivors do affect where you go as killer. You will then know how to avoid this when playing Survivor either that be alone or with friends.

Muito Bom! Mas com amigos fica ainda melhor
its fun but some of the bugs they have are just stupid

good game but the devs are deaf to community feedback and with every balancing patch it is more evident that they dont play their own game. Also, the game is an unbearable grindfest. and not the good kind like warframe

Update: the devs have taken it even further now. Instead of listening to community feedback they have actively punished a streamer, for calling out the lead designer on not knowing how skill is measured in this game, by taking away his twitch cosmetics in-game.
This shows such unrivaled pettines that it makes me believe that they actually know how to properly balance the game but dont do it just to be petty towards everyone complaining about game balance.

This is an interesting one. I love it and hate it. It's fun at times, yet insanely frustrating at other times. Also worth noting, as with most games that have even a semi-competitive edge to them, it can be incredibly toxic.

Matchmaking is pretty bad. More than half of the time as killer or survivor, you wont get close matches. You'll either dominate or be dominated, and the ranks will be all over the place. Sometimes as killer you'll come across people who are the top rank with 1000 hours who know exactly how to waste your time and make you chase them around the map while their teammates get all the gens done, other times you'll get lower ranked survivors with 75 hours who unintentionally throw themselves at you. Also, with the way ranking works, if you get yourself to a decent killer ranking, you pretty much cannot learn how to play as a new killer you just unlocked and have fun while doing it as the ranks are shared.

Most of the game comes down to playtime. You need to play a bunch to learn all the maps and their layouts so you can be an effective survivor/killer. You need to [strike] play [/strike] [b] grind [/b] a bunch to earn enough bloodpoints to be able to level your killers and survivors so you can get the crucial meta perks. I have 231 hours at the time of this review and have about half of the meta perks, and only about 5 or 6 killers leveled to a usable state.

The game allows you to play public matches as a survivor with up to 3 other friends, or play custom matches with up to 4 other friends. Unfortunately that means that when you play as killer you could potentially go against a group of 4 people queued together who are able to freely talk among each other, giving your position away at every second, making the game significantly survivor sided.

There are a bunch of unwritten rules in the game, as well. Mostly about how a killer should/shouldn't play but there are some for survivors. Sometimes they're followed, most times they're not. Survivors will complain about killers tunneling, killers will complain about survivors tea bagging them to rub salt in the wound.

As I said at the start, the game can be fun but it can just as easily be infuriating.

I'd definitely recommend the game. It's fun and I've clearly gotten my moneys worth. My biggest gripe is that the game is NOT balanced to high end gameplay. It's balanced to mid-low ranks. Skilled oillers are at a clear disadvantage against a team of skilled survivors, ESPECIALLY when its survive with friends. I'd go as far as saying a skilled killer is easily out-matched by an less-than-average group of survivors playing with each other and providing information over comms. If you can ignore those cons, it's a fun game.

Muy entretenido sobre todo cuando lo juegas con amigos, Lo unico que molesta es la gente que espera que le hagan todo y no ayuda en nada, por eso es mejor jugarlo en conjunto pero muy buen juego :3 <3

Game idea is good but the rest of it is very bad. The hitboxes are sometimes bigger than Kim Kardashian's a**, you're getting hit through pallets, windows and sometimes through walls. The community is also kinda toxic, you will get tunneled and facecamped if you're a survivor who is just doing the objective of the game. :)

This is a lot of fun but it can be frustrating to learn how to play, matchmaking isn't great so you'll probably have to play against a lot of higher skilled players who will run rings around you, a lot of good guides on Youtube to learn stuff though, Otz is good to watch for this.

This is one of my favorite games

finally, my fantasies about surviving against my favorite horror movie monsters and being the "final girl", or actually being the monster and killing everyone, can finally be played out! 

honestly, this is the kind of game that you play a few times then are done. its pretty repetitive. every round may have a new map and a new killer but the general goal of the game is the same- fix generators, and try to survive and escape. and as the killer, you just circle the map till you find a survivor, slash em and hook em. thats about it. it still is exciting and thrilling and ill still play it and recommend it to others! but in the main game there just isnt much variety. again, it is still a lot of fun and all of the DLC characters are really great, its fun seeing all these characters you recognize in a game. id recommend it to anyone and think everyone should give it a shot!

Toda la ventaja tiene el asesino, si mata a alguien y se lo lleva, puede seguir golpeando...? donde la viste? aparte que corren demasiado rapido, una mierda de juego. Si te queres tiltear o vivirla como asesino, instalalo, pero la verdad que no me gusto un joraca.
Fun to play with friends. Would recommend!

There is nothing fun about this gameplay loop. No matter what perks you get, survivors can generally expect most chases to last about 5-15 seconds. There are exceptions but there in general is no reward for "Progress" As a killer you can expect the survivors to take every chance to be toxic. This community is awful and the developer is completely inept in handling bugs and community feedback. Don't buy this game.
